definition: to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: The manager threw his weight on a bad evaluation of a new employee who he did not like.
sentences.chinese: 经理仗势欺人对那个他不喜欢的新员工做了怀的评价。

sentences.english: Some cadres' children take advantage of their parents' power to bully their classmates at school.
sentences.chinese: 某些干部子女仗势欺人，在学校欺负同班同学。

sentences.english: And a friend who bullies us is no longer a friend.
sentences.chinese: 仗势欺人就算不上是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Don't try to throw weight around. It won't work with me.
sentences.chinese: 别仗势欺人，你这一套对我行不通。

definition: to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
see 恃強欺弱|恃强欺弱[shi4 qiang2 qi1 ruo4]
to rely on power
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
domineering/bossy
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
to stir up trouble
rude and unreasonable
arrogant/overbearing
to bully/to push around
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
evil tyrant
arrogant and despotic
